byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN

abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds deep bipartisan support in American electorate for overhauling financing of political campaigns and for new measure to restrict influence wealthy donors have in politics; significant margin of those polled disagree with argument used by Supreme Court in its Citizens United ruling.
lead_paragraph: Americans of both parties reject the regime of untrammeled money in elections, but more than half are pessimistic that improvements will be made.

headline.main: Poll Shows Americans Favor an Overhaul of Campaign Financing
headline.print_headline: Poll Shows Americans Favor an Overhaul of Campaign Financing

snippet: Americans of both parties reject the regime of untrammeled money in elections, but more than half are pessimistic that improvements will be made.

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
